alert.note: Alert for Marin; Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 7:41AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A cold front is moving northwest to southeast through the Bay Area on Saturday. Periods of heavy rain and strong southerly wind gusts will be the main impacts from the storm system. Periods of heavy rain may result in localized flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin, Napa and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.10 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Napa, Petaluma, Novato, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Sonoma, Sebastopol, Cotati, St. Helena, Calistoga, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Roseland, Larkfield-Wikiup, Boyes Hot Springs, Tomales, Black Point-Green Point, Dillon Beach and Point Reyes Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
